meanings.sent1: The sly fox gulled the naive rabbit into giving him all his carrots.
meanings.sent2: She felt ashamed when she realized she had been gulled by the smooth-talking salesman.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat gullied the unsuspecting dog into chasing its own tail.
meanings.sent4: The con artist had a way of gullying people out of their hard-earned money.
meanings.sent5: The magician's illusion gulled the audience into believing the impossible.

meanings.sent1: The dishonest shopkeeper gulled his customers by selling fake products.
meanings.sent2: He was known for trying to gulled people out of their savings with his get-rich-quick schemes.
meanings.sent3: The cunning thief tried to gulled the old lady out of her valuable jewelry.
meanings.sent4: The scammer's smooth talk was used to gulled innocent victims out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The swindler's elaborate plan was designed to gulled the wealthy businessman out of his fortune.

meanings.sent1: The gullible child believed everything he was told without question.
meanings.sent2: She was so gullible that she fell for the same trick multiple times.
meanings.sent3: The gullible tourist bought a bridge thinking it was a great deal.
meanings.sent4: Being gullible in the city made him an easy target for pickpockets.
meanings.sent5: The gullible puppy followed anyone who offered it a treat, regardless of their intentions.
